description: From Late Latin humiliatus, past participle of humiliare (“to abase, humble”), from Latin humilis (“lowly, humble”), from humus (“ground; earth, soil”); see humble.

verbs.description: humiliate (third-person singular simple present humiliates, present participle humiliating, simple past and past participle humiliated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cause to be ashamed; to injure the dignity and self-respect of.
examples: Synonyms: debase, demean, disgrace, mortify, shame; see also Thesaurus:abash

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make humble; to lower in condition or status.
